英國有網站聲稱用超級電腦，根據各隊實力、熱身賽成績同球員買賣，詳細分析後預測邊一隊經過5輪比賽後會坐喺榜首。

《talksport》網站表示，經過超級電腦分析之後，預計曼城經過5輪英超後有4勝1和成績，得13分排榜首；第2位係使錢冇咁多嘅利物浦，都係4勝1和，得失球差唔及藍月排第2。而曼聯、車路士同阿仙奴就分別排3至5。如果前5排名係咁相當好多球迷都會預測到，使乜靠超級電腦；不過佢哋估第6位就大膽啲，話來季升班馬紐卡素首5戰會有2勝2和1負成績排第6，至於上季亞軍熱刺就只得第7。網站預測5輪英超後，包尾嘅會係史篤城，5場波只會得1分。

http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/newcastle-more-business-alan-pardew-13451065
琴晚白頭佬上Skysports講紐記, 都幾中point

Alan Pardew on Newcastle’s spending power:

“I think what you have to remember at Newcastle, and it was the same in the period that I was there, is that what the club generates the manager has access to. And unfortunately it doesn’t generate the same figures some of the bigger clubs do. Newcastle, as we all know, class themselves as a massive club.

“The money you can get from shirt sponsorship and TV money is all there (to spend) but of course that gets used up very, very quickly. I do think they’ve got an armoury there but I think some of the prices they’ve been quoted for players won’t have evolved how they’d have wanted. But the external money coming into the game from Chinese money, from states - Qatar and the Emirates – and from super stadiums like Arsenal and West Ham and Everton mean these clubs are a little bit advanced from Newcastle.

Alan Pardew on Newcastle’s spending:

“I still think there’s some business to be done there.
“You look at a lot of clubs – and I’m not defending the policies there by any means. I think Newcastle need two or three big players to go in there because Brighton, for a starting XI, are actually slightly stronger than Newcastle. They need that starting XI. Newcastle’s squad was bigger and had more options in that (Championship) run-in but they need to have that starting XI improved.

“I think Rafa has got the backing of the fans. They’re with him and that’s massive thing for the football club. They need to look after him and the board need to back him.

“I don’t think it’s realistic to expect £100million of transfers . I think that figure would be wages included, probably, and everything that comes in will be balanced against that.

“Some of these free transfers are very, very expensive. We took Mandana from Marseille (at Palace) and he was a lot of money, despite being a free transfer.

“There’s still a lot of business to be done in this transfer window and Newcastle will be one of them.”

Pardew on what’s to come next:

“I’ll be very surprised if they don’t spend more than Brighton and Huddersfield (by the end of the window) .

“One thing you’ve got to have at Newcastle is an entertainer. I look at that team - OK you’ve got Perez, maybe one or two others – but you need a big hitter. I think that’s what they’re trying to nail down. I’m not talking with any insight, by the way but I’d be surprised if they don’t bring what I would call an entertainer, a striker, a flair player who can get those Geordie boys off their seats.

“That will be their strength, their home form. Burnley won ten games at home. You can’t tell me Newcastle can’t do that.”

Pardew on Newcastle’s fans:

“When I was there the biggest attraction you had was the fans. When I sat down and talked with a player and said ‘Do you want to play for Newcastle’ you just show them an iPad with a video of the fans and the passion and they’re all in. Unfortunately it’s just the finance to move into the scale of the top seven, top eight now.

“That’s where Newcastle want to get to but it’s going to be very difficult for Rafa unless there’s some external money.”

Speaking at the Premier League launch day, Benitez responded to talk he would quit and said: “No, I decided to stay.

“When I decided to stay it’s because for me it’s a challenge.

“For me, I’m not totally happy with what we did but I will try to do my best, working very hard with people at the club to try and improve what we have at the moment.

“It’s very difficult (for me to walk away).

“My Chinese is not good enough! Now I try to do my best now.

“It has to be something you cannot control.

“At the moment I am fully committed to do the best that I can do now.”

Benitez also hinted that he could unveil another signing before the end of the week.

He said: “With the transfer window open until the end of August, you can still bring players but before the game, you bring anyone in and they will be available for game.

“But they would need to know our tactics and I don’t think we would have time to do that.

“But if we bring someone in before the end (of the week), it will be a boost for everyone.”

However, asked to sum up his mood in one word on Friday as he prepared for Sunday's opening fixture at home to Tottenham, Benitez said: "Commitment.

"I say that my commitment is there. If we do what we have to do and do it in a professional way, thinking about football as a priority, we can improve.

"We have a massive club and a city behind the team, so we can improve. But we have to do things thinking about football, that is the key. If you are successful on the pitch, everything else will come.

"I'm here. My commitment is 100 percent. I will try to do my best. If you have two or three new players, or five or six or eight, it doesn't matter. What we have to be sure is that the 25 players that we will have will give everything.''

“For example, I thought it was the right thing to do was to generate as much money as possible for Newcastle, so when people say to me: ‘Whatever you do on an interview do not talk about changing the name of St James’ Park!’

“Well I’m me, and I’m going to talk about making an error, and I should not have changed the name of St James’ Park. I should not have done that. "

Mike Ashley prepared to SELL Newcastle United - but warns he won't pump any more money into the club

Mike Ashley says he WILL sell Newcastle United to anybody who can prove they are wealthier than him.

The club attracted interest from the Far East earlier in the summer but no bids for United were forthcoming and Newcastle boss Rafa Benitez has had to push on in the transfer market without much backing in the last three months.

Speaking to Sky Sports, Ashley said he would sell to the right bidder. He commented: “If somebody would like come along and take this seat and fund Newcastle with a nought on the end with their wealth more than me, I will not stand in Newcastle United’s way.

“One of the reasons I’m doing this interview is that I don’t think you’ll find there’s many people out there who will actually stand up and do it.

“I think we’re going to be together a good while longer and we’ve got the man in Rafa and let’s hope that we can generate some funds and we give him some chance to get some building blocks going over the coming years.”

Ashley also stated he had no more personal funds to plough into the club.

He said: “I’ve put my £250million into the football club.

“Guys, that’s it.

“There’s no more from me.

“Now the club has to generate its own money.”

Ashley also stated he had no more personal funds to plough into the club.

He said: “I’ve put my £250million into the football club.

“Guys, that’s it.

“There’s no more from me.

“Now the club has to generate its own money.”
